intro: Mesembryanthemum subrigidum, commonly known as the rigid ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white powder. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and yellow, typically blooming in spring and summer. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. Mesembryanthemum subrigidum is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
